721430f.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street
721430f.text:
This photograph shows the original rendition of the Presbyterian Hospital, Madison Avenue between 70th.71ct Streets, as planned by Richard M. Hunt. Hunt's stamp, at the lower right, is dated Dec. 15,
1899.
James Lenox was the prine mover behind the Presbyterian Hospital, and he donated the site. Ihis rendition by Hunt was owned by Lenox, and is marked as coming from the Lenox collection (below).

721425f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street
721425f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, south from 70th Street, showing Presbyterian Hospital and a new apartment building.
June 21, 1927.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

714293f-a.title: Manhattan: 70th Street - Madison Avenue
714293f-a.text:
(1)
Building of the Presbytarian Hospital, 70th Street, north
side, betseen Madison and Park Avenues.
March 31,1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(s)
The samegshowing a little more of the court.
March 31,1928.
P. L. Sperr.

714294f-a.title: Manhattan: 70th Street - Madison Avenue
714294f-a.text:
Presbyterian Hospital, 70th Street, north side, between
Madison and Park Avenues.
March 31,1928.
P. L. Sperr.

721426f.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street (East)
721426f.text:
Madison Ave. (left) at the N.E. corner of East 70th Street (right), showing the Dispensary of the Presbyterian Hospital under demolition. Upon this site stands a corner of an 11-story apartment house that occupies the entire Ave. front. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
May 21, 1928.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.

721427f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street
721427f-a.text:
(1)
Madison Ave., east side, north from 70th Street, showing the Presbyterian Hospital in the foreground just before its demolition. Site now (1935) occupied by an apartment building with stores built
about 1930.
March 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same showing a clear outline of the buildings beyond the
Hospital.
March 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

721429f.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street
721429f.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, 70th to 71st Streets, showing Presbyterian Hospital detail, shortly before demolition, and St. James Episcopal
Church detail, on N.E. corner of 71st Street.
March 31, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

721431f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 70th Street
721431f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, from 70th to 71st Streets. In foreground on east side Presbyterian Hospital has just been demolished.
June 8, 1928.
P.L.Sperr, Photographer.

714295f-b.title: Manhattan: 70th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714295f-b.text:
(1)
East 70th Street, north side, east from and including Madison Ave. The view shows the south side of the Presbyterian Hospital.
June 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; from a view point further eastward.
March 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Sheaigg the Hespital antrance on East 70th Street.
June 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

714296f-a.title: Manhattan: 70th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
714296f-a.text:
East 70th Street, south side, west from (No. 16), but not including Madison Ave. The building shown in the center is Nos. 4-8, the Marshall Field mansion, erected in 1925-1926 at a cost of 400,O00. This property has been sold and the purchaser5s will erect two 12-story apartment houses here. For
details See The New York Times of March 23, 1937.
March 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
